page.title: 03Industries and Housing
page.content: CROXDALE LIES HALF A MILE NORTH OF TUDHOE COLLIERY, BUILT TO HOUSE MINING FAMILIES ON THE SALVIN ESTATE.THE SALVINS HAVE RESIDED HERE FOR THE PAST 500 YEARS. CROXDALE IS IN THE DURHAM DISTRICT, THE BOUNDARY BEING THE NICKYNACK BECK.UP TO 1830 SPENNYMOOR WAS WASTE OR MOORLAND WHEN IT RAPIDLY DEVELOPED INTO A COAL-MINING BOOM-TOWN, COMPLETE WITH A RAILWAY AND A HUGE IRONWORKS COMPLEX. ALL HAVE LONG SINCE DISAPPEARED. TODAY THE TOWN IS MODERN AND REDEVELOPED WITH LIGHT INDUSTRIES. MAJOR NATIONAL COMPANIES OPERATE ON TWO LARGE INDUSTRIAL ESTATES AT MERRINGTON LANE & GREEN LANE. SEVERAL NEW PRIVATE & COUNCIL HOUSING ESTATES PROVIDE AN EXCELLENT & EXTENSIVE RANGE OF LIVING ACCOMODATION IN THE AREA. DISTRICT COUNCIL OFFICES ARE CONVENIENTLY LOCATED AT GREEN LANE.
